briefdescription.para: If 0 then Old mode (top left origin), if 1 then New Hough mode( bottom Center).
Number of lines the hough transform should find.

Size of the Acuumlator's lenght. Must be able to fit the largest posible value of rho. Max rho = Sqrt( ScreenHeight^2+ (ScreenWidth/2)^2), because the origin is the bottom center and the max rho is top left or right.
How big the steps are for a potiential theta. In degreees. Large values reduce computation but less acurate.
How big the steps are for a potiential rho values. Large values reduce computation but less acurate.
Inorder to make computations go faster, not every pixels is anylzed every time. 1 out of This value squared is analzed each pass.
Inorder to make drawing go faster, not every pixels is updated every time. 1 out of This value squared is updated each pass.
Number of degrees around a maximum to clear around before searching the Accumulator again.
Number of rho values around a maximum to clear around before searching the Accumulator again.
Used by the smooth method. Dimension of Number of pixels to look around for the smooth function. This (values*2)^2 = number of pixels checked.
If true then steering desisions will be based off the theta's of the hough transform.
Texture object that represents the robot camera's current view.
TrueFalse maps used for marking pixels either "good" or "bad".
Screen Width of the image to analze.
Screen Height of the image to analze.
The turn indicator measures measures how much the analysis things the robot should go right or left. Right = positive. Left = negative.

Stores information about lines from the hough transform. each polarRho we want to find = 7 more values to store 0=slope, 1= yInt, 2=Rho, 3=Theta, 4=Xvalue, 5=Yvalue, 6= size of the bin 5 more ending values for the averages.

Stores vector3 locations of the beginning and end points of two lines on the screen. Was part of the old Hough system, but potientially still useful, so has not deleted. 0 = start location of line, 1 = end location ofline.
Color Array 2D from the robot camera that is analzed.
Color Array 2D from the robot camera that is analzed. Can't extract informatino directly from the robot view Texture to 2D. But have to go through 1D array.
These values are the incremented numbers used in the giant double "for-loops". The "1" values are the for the first "for-loop".
These values are the incremented numbers used in the giant double "for-loops". The "2" values are the for the second "for-loop".
An array of the middle clear pixels for each row. The length of the array is the number of rows = this.screenHeight.
Number of white pixels the "FindWhite" found.
The accumlator for the hough values. Each position is a hough Bin. Each bin represents a line in Cartessian cordinates. The Accumlator is basically in polar cordinates. Theta,rho.
Used by the smooth method. How many pixels must also be white in the area around a white pixel for it to be counted white.
On a scale of 0-255 how high does a pixel RGB value have to be before being declared white.
Sets red_good, blue_good, green_good to this value.
The drawingImageAnalysis class handles the vertex information the shows what the robot is thinking.

memberdef.argsstring: (Game game, Vector2 screenSize, List< Viewport > viewPortList1)
memberdef.name: ImageAnalysis

briefdescription.para: Initializes a new instance of the ImageAnalysis class.

parameterdescription.para: The game associated with the class
The size of the sceen to analze
A list of the view ports

briefdescription.para: Called when the class is initialized. Creates many of the arrays and sets many of the values.
Stores the texture from the robot camera in a color array before the texture is disposed. Expicitly called in the SimulationMain Draw method.

parameterdescription.para: Clock Information

briefdescription.para: Takes a 2D renderTarget/Texture and sets it as the image to analze. Explicitly called in the SimulationMain Draw Method.

parameterdescription.para: The texture to analze.

briefdescription.para: Calls the analysis methods that actually do all the work. Basically the Main function for the Image Analysis Class.

parameterdescription.para: Clock Info

briefdescription.para: Gets the Hough mode. 0 = Old, 1 = New.

simplesect.para: "Old" if in the old mode, "New" if in the new mode

briefdescription.para: Allows the SimulationMain to get the turnIndicator.
Takes a texture and makes it into a 2D color array. Passing in the arrays is faster than trying to build it each time.

parameterdescription.para: Texture to extract color information
1D array needed for the extraction
2D array that will be returned

simplesect.para: The 2D color array of the texture color information

briefdescription.para: Takes a 2D color array and finds the pixels that are "white".

parameterdescription.para: The color array to find white in.

simplesect.para: The TrueFalse bool map of white pixels. True = white, False = not white.

briefdescription.para: Determines if white pixels meet the Width threshold to possibly be a line. NOT IN USE RIGHT NOW********************.

parameterdescription.para: The TrueFalse map of whate Pixels

simplesect.para: A truefalse map of white pixels that met the line width requirement

briefdescription.para: Takes a truefalse map and for each pixel checks the other pixels around it to see if they are also white. If the number of pixels arround it that are also white is above a threshold then keep that pixel white. Meant to reduce noise in the picture. NOT IN USE RIGHT NOW********************.

parameterdescription.para: The raw truefalse map of whie pixels.
The trueFalse map to modify

simplesect.para: The truefalse map of pixels that met the threshold requirements.

briefdescription.para: Find a path through the map to go through and return it as a bool map, also set the turn indicator. Based off the reactiveNavigation from the old robot code.

parameterdescription.para: The trueFalse map of pixels that are blocked.
Blank. This map will be turned.

simplesect.para: The trueFalse map of a clear path.

briefdescription.para: Finds Max value in Hough. Store information about that max.

parameterdescription.para: The accumlator of bins we want to search
How large is the quantitization of the theta values.
What value in the Array 'HoughInfo' should we start storing information.

memberdef.argsstring: (double x1, double y1, double slope1, int startIndexforStorageArray)
memberdef.name: CalculateStartandStopofLine

briefdescription.para: Part of the old Hough system. Finds the edge values on the screen of the lines based on the slope and yInt.

parameterdescription.para: Slope of the line
YIntercept of the line
Where to store the information in the storage array

briefdescription.para: For each white pixel that might be part of a line, Find all the potiential lines going through it and store each vote for that line in the accumlator's bins. Calls the methods to search through the accumlator to find the bins with the largest values.

parameterdescription.para: The trueFalse array of pixels that might be part of a line.

briefdescription.para: Find the average theta values. Weigh them according to the rho value of each one. Make a turning desision based off the weighted thetas if turnBytheta is on.
Clears the array arround the maximum. Gets information about the line to clear around from the 'this.houghInfo' array.

parameterdescription.para: The Accumulator to clear around
The theta quantitization
How far into the 'this.houghInfo' array is the data for the line we want to clear around

simplesect.para: The accumulator with the values around the max cleared.

briefdescription.para: It was easier to redure 640*480 small triangles and view then from a distance than to put a texture on the GPU So there is a camera to view the triangels. The class only analzes a small fraction of the pixels each time through the game loop inorder to keep the speed high. Many of the methods have loops that cause them to only look at every X pixel each time through and then the next time through a different set. Basically it functions like a giant double "for" loop.

detaileddescription.para: The Image Analysis Class does the image processing of the robot view.
